content: Yes, an interesting piece of mythology or ancient history... I have heard other similar tales of Lilith (equally enthralling).
reply: Yes, an interesting piece of mythology or ancient history... I have heard other similar tales of Lilith (equally enthralling).
title: Favorite Myths

content: I do find Lilith fascinating as a character. We seem to need her, as the accounts simultaneous creation of male and female found in the Bible and in the Qur'an are too peaceful for us- humans love conflict. They are also too egalitarian for a patriarchal world- for how can you have patriarchy without the subservient good girl and the bold bad girl?

content: What better way to subjugate half of the human race than to create a story where the women are "evil" or need to be "controlled"? And so began the subjugation and assault on "mother earth." Aaaah, so much can be deduced from these early legends and ancient mythology.

content: quote: Originally posted by tawodi: Who had no idea how to crawl........... but when she stood up, the things that she did, would drive you straight through the wall!! I think she was "myth" october 1967!! Bruce, I'm afraid I can't give you a passing grade on your limerick. Here's how your score breaks down: Line 1: (Minus 5 points) You could have used someplace familiar, such as St. Paul, instead of someplace obscure. Line 2: (Minus 5 points) A good limerick should contain something shocking or attention grabbing in the first two lines. EXAMPLE: 1. There once was a man named Dave; 2. Who kept a wh0re in a cave; See? That makes you WANT to hear the rest. Yours is just weak. Sorry. Lines 3 & 4: Should rhyme. Minus 20 points. Line 5: (Minus 5 points) Doesn't really say anything, doesn't end in a pun or a surprise, just doesn't leave you with anything. And finally, Minus 25 points for failing the ultimate test of a limerick: can you tell it to a preacher without blushing? If the answer is yes, you don't have a true limerick. Your total score: 40 out of a possible 100. Minimum passing score: 70. Thanks for playing, and we have some lovely parting gifts backstage. Give him a big hand for playing, folks! [Applause] 3 second interval [/Applause]
